area_name: Eat Out More Often (aka Power Glide)

content.description:
The easiest route here, but that's not saying much, a good route to work for those of us who are either too fat, or lousy at crimping (or both, like me).

The first two holds are good, but the next set are crimpy, then there's a final little rail with less than satisfactory crimps, and from there you have to make a powerful pull to reach the finishing hold, once you have this in hand, plan on some careful footwork to ensure success.

Start low on a big greasy layback in the cave. (spotter good incase you grease to keep your head from smashing)

reach out and up and grab good slopers.

Work it out to the crimps (crux) move up and out.
content.location: Start in small cave to left shown in photo for area.

content.description: Start from a well chalked hold and move up the face past a horizontal to the crux - a pocket and flake which are used to launch to the lip above, then mantle and top out.
content.protection: Pads, spotter(s) for the high crux and uneven landing
content.location: East side of the boulder and facing the main trail.

pathTokens: Eat Out More Often (aka Power Glide)
